articles.headline: He’s One of the Biggest Backers of Trump’s Push to Protect American Steel. And He’s Canadian.
articles.snippet: Barry Zekelman’s campaign to fight imports is a case study in how to gain access in Washington. His company is the largest steel industry donor to the president’s political operation.
articles.abstract: Barry Zekelman’s campaign to fight imports is a case study in how to gain access in Washington. His company is the largest steel industry donor to the president’s political operation.
articles.lead_paragraph: HARROW, Ontario — Barry Zekelman, a Canadian billionaire whose business is mostly in the United States, is not a guy who likes to lose — or go slow.

articles.headline: Trump’s Secrecy Fight Escalates as Judge Rules for Congress in Early Test
articles.snippet: A judge ruled that Trump’s accounting firm must turn over his financial records even as the White House told a former top Trump aide not to show up at a hearing.
articles.abstract: A judge ruled that Trump’s accounting firm must turn over his financial records even as the White House told a former top Trump aide not to show up at a hearing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The fight over President Trump’s systematic stonewalling of Congress escalated on two fronts on Monday, as a federal judge upheld a subpoena for his financial records even as the White House instructed its former top lawyer to defy a subpoena to testify before lawmakers.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Why Workers Without College Degrees Are Fleeing Big Cities
articles.snippet: Metropolitan areas long offered work and wages that drew job seekers. Now it depends on your education, and the ability to offset high housing prices.
articles.abstract: Metropolitan areas long offered work and wages that drew job seekers. Now it depends on your education, and the ability to offset high housing prices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Metropolitan areas long offered work and wages that drew job seekers. Now it depends on your education, and the ability to offset high housing prices.
articles.byline: By Eduardo Porter and Guilbert Gates

articles.headline: The Economy Is Strong and Inflation Is Low. That’s What Worries the Fed.
articles.snippet: The Fed’s struggle to coax inflation to its 2 percent target signals the faltering of a foundational economic relationship. That could create a problem in the next recession.
articles.abstract: The Fed’s struggle to coax inflation to its 2 percent target signals the faltering of a foundational economic relationship. That could create a problem in the next recession.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — America’s job market is booming and the economy is strong, but that combination is not raising prices the way it used to.

articles.headline: In a Test of Their Power, #MeToo’s Legal Forces Take On McDonald’s
articles.snippet: In newly filed complaints, McDonald’s employees described repeated sexual harassment and then punishment for speaking out.
articles.abstract: In newly filed complaints, McDonald’s employees described repeated sexual harassment and then punishment for speaking out.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2016, when she was 16, Brittany Hoyos started her first job, at a busy McDonald’s in Tucson. Not long after, she said, a manager began harassing her, touching her hair, texting her about her appearance and once making a move to kiss her after offering her a ride home.

articles.headline: Democratic Calls for Impeachment Inquiry Grow as Leaders Instead Vow to Toughen Tactics
articles.snippet: Some Progressive Democrats have joined calls for an impeachment inquiry, arguing that it will strengthen the party’s efforts to stop President Trump’s stonewalling.
articles.abstract: Some Progressive Democrats have joined calls for an impeachment inquiry, arguing that it will strengthen the party’s efforts to stop President Trump’s stonewalling.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A bloc of liberal Democrats began pressing on Tuesday for an impeachment inquiry of President Trump, underscoring party divisions and the growing difficulties that Speaker Nancy Pelosi faces as she tries to chart a more methodical course.

articles.headline: New Coke Was a Debacle. It’s Coming Back. Blame ‘Stranger Things.’
articles.snippet: The creators of the hit Netflix series wrote the failed beverage into the coming season as part of a big marketing push. With memories of a 1985 backlash faded, Coca-Cola dug out the old recipe.
articles.abstract: The creators of the hit Netflix series wrote the failed beverage into the coming season as part of a big marketing push. With memories of a 1985 backlash faded, Coca-Cola dug out the old recipe.
articles.lead_paragraph: New Coke, the soft drink that drew a nationwide backlash in 1985, is back. And the credit, or blame, for the return of Coca-Cola’s greatest folly goes to Netflix.

articles.headline: Huawei’s U.S. Restrictions Expose a High-Tech Achilles’ Heel for China
articles.snippet: China is heavily reliant on imported computer chips, despite efforts to develop its own semiconductor industry.
articles.abstract: China is heavily reliant on imported computer chips, despite efforts to develop its own semiconductor industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — For all of China’s efforts to become a global force in high technology rivaling the United States, it has mostly failed to produce top-flight contenders in one crucial area: the industry that gave Silicon Valley its name.
